name.text: DDL - Referential Integrity and Foreign Keys

text.p: Assume you're asked to modify the script so that the attribute "idProd" is a foreign key that corresponds to the "id" attribute in the Product relation. Additionally, the "idProd" attribute should never have a NULL value and when its value is updated we want the "cascade" behaviour to be used. A database engineer was given this task and came up with the answers shown below (assume the rest of the script remains identical to the one shown above). Which of the answers is correct?

feedback.text: Since the Product relation doesn't have its "id" attribute marked as a primary key, we have to specify it's the one we want to be used. Also, the "on update" statement needs to come before "not null" in this case. Therefore, this is the only option that fits the requirements.
